text:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
originalText:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card from his or her hand.

name: Advance Scout
text:
First strike
{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
originalText:
First strike
{W} Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"The soldier's path is worn smooth by the tread of many feet—all in one direction, none returning."
—Oracle en-Vec

text: Flying
flavor: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.
originalText: Flying
name: Air Elemental

text:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: If only every message were as perfect as its bearer.
originalText:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
name: Angelic Page
Arc Lightning

rulings.text: You choose how many targets Arc Lightning has and how the damage is divided as you cast the spell. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

If some of the creatures are illegal targets as Arc Lightning tries to resolve, the original division of damage still applies but no damage is dealt to the illegal targets. If all targets are illegal, Arc Lightning is countered.

text: Arc Lightning deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures and/or players.
originalText: Arc Lightning deals 3 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
flavor: Rainclouds don't last long in Shiv, but that doesn't stop the lightning.

text: {T}: Untap two target lands.
flavor:
Sharpen your ears
—Elvish expression meaning
"grow wiser"
originalText: {T}: Untap two target lands.
name: Argothian Elder

rulings.text: The ability can target an already untapped land.
The ability must target two different lands. It can't be activated if there is just one land to target.

name: Armored Pegasus
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor:
"I always charge a little extra to take on a pegasus. They fly like eagles, kick like mules, and hide like hermits."
—Tahlil en-Dal, bounty hunter

text: Flying
flavor:
Little dreamt could seem so cruel
As waiting for the wings outspread,
The jagged teeth, the burning eyes,
And dagger-claws that clench to nerves.
originalText: Flying
name: Azure Drake

text: {0}: Return Blinking Spirit to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"Don't look at it! Maybe it'll go away!"
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician
originalText: {0}: Return Blinking Spirit to its owner's hand.
name: Blinking Spirit
Broken Fall
text: Return Broken Fall to its owner's hand: Regenerate target creature.
originalText: Return Broken Fall to its owner's hand: Regenerate target creature.
flavor:
"I think I used up all my good luck and all my bad luck in the same fall."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

text: When Cackling Fiend enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.
flavor: Its windpipe is only the first to amplify its maddening laughter.
originalText: When Cackling Fiend comes into play, each opponent discards a card from his or her hand.
name: Cackling Fiend

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, this has no effect.

name: Catastrophe

rulings.text: You choose land or creatures when the spell resolves.

text: Destroy all lands or all creatures. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
originalText: Destroy all creatures or all lands. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
flavor: Radiant's eyes flashed. "Go, then," the angel spat at Serra, "and leave this world to those who truly care."

{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Cinder Marsh doesn't untap during your next untap phase.

Enchant creature

originalText: Counter target spell.

text: Flying, haste

name: Curfew
text: Each player returns a creature he or she controls to its owner's hand.
originalText: Each player returns a creature he or she controls to its owner's hand.
flavor: ". . . But I'm not tired!"

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

originalText: Whenever an opponent plays a land, put a +1/+1 counter on Dirtcowl Wurm.
name: Dirtcowl Wurm

rulings.text: A spell or ability that tells a player to "put a land onto the battlefield" does not count as playing a land.

name: Disenchant

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

"I implore you not to forget the horrors of the past. You would have us start the Brothers' War anew"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

originalText: {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

"Teferi is a problem student. Always late for class. No appreciation for constructive use of time."

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

name: Land Tax

rulings.text: You can fetch any of the "Snow-Covered" lands, since they all also have the supertype basic.

This ability has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless any one of your opponents controls more lands than you, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you control at least as many lands as each of your opponents by the time it resolves.
You shuffle your library if you search, even if you don't put any basic land cards into your hand.

text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, then put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

text: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.
flavor:
"Ach! Hans, run! It's the Lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words
originalText: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.
name: Lhurgoyf

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor: A lightning elemental once killed an entire tribe of merfolk—simply by going for a swim.
originalText: Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
name: Lightning Elemental

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
name: Living Death

rulings.text: The creatures which are sacrificed can't be regenerated.

Both players exile their creature cards at once. Then both players sacrifice all creatures they control at once. Then both players put all creatures they exiled onto the battlefield. If there are any choices involved for a given step, the current player makes their choices first, then the other player, and finally you do the action all at once.

"All cards he or she exiled this way" refers only to the cards exiled in the first part of the effect. If a replacement effect (such as Leyline of the Void) exiles any of the sacrificed creatures instead of putting them into the graveyard, those cards aren't returned to the battlefield.

text: Each player exiles all creature cards from his or her graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures he or she controls, then puts all cards he or she exiled this way onto the battlefield.
originalText: Set aside all creature cards in all graveyards. Then put each creature that's in play into its owner's graveyard. Then put each creature card set aside this way into play under its owner's control.

text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

Enchant creature

name: Pestilence

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.
Note that "until end of turn" effects wear off after "at the beginning of the end step" triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.

text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
originalText:
At end of turn, if there are no creatures in play, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B} Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

name: Raging Goblin
Ray of Command

rulings.text: You may target an untapped creature with Ray of Command.

The creature returns to the opponent when the "until end of turn" effect wears off during the cleanup step. It taps during the Cleanup step (if it is not already tapped), so any abilities triggered off it tapping happen at that time.
You tap the creature when you lose control of it for any reason -- because Ray of Command's effect ends, or because a spell or ability causes another player to gain control of it.

text: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.
originalText: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
flavor: "Heel."

name: Reanimate

rulings.text: You lose life equal to the converted mana cost of the card you're bringing back, so if you Reanimate Volrath's Shapeshifter, you lose three life, regardless of what the next card down is.

text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
originalText: Put target creature card from a graveyard into play under your control. You lose life equal to that creature's converted mana cost.
flavor:
"You will learn to earn death."
—Volrath

rulings.text: X can be zero.
If X is greater than zero, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and X targets. If X is zero, you can't choose any targets.

originalText: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
flavor: There are only two rules of tactics: never be without a plan, and never rely on it.
originalText: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
name: Seasoned Marshal

rulings.text: Can target an already tapped creature if you want.

text: {T}: Untap target creature.
flavor:
"We shun them not for their dream but for their refusal to let such a noble dream die a noble death."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
originalText: {T}: Untap target creature.
name: Seeker of Skybreak

rulings.text: It can use its tap ability to untap itself.

text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, if Sengir Vampire dealt damage to it this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
name: Sengir Vampire

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

name: Sewer Rats
text: {B}, Pay 1 life: Sewer Rats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than three times each turn.
originalText: {B}, Pay 1 life: Sewer Rats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. No more than {B}{B}{B} may be spent this way each turn.
flavor:
You lie down with rats, and the rats run away.
—Suq'Ata insult

name: Shower of Sparks

rulings.text: If the creature leaves the battlefield before this resolves, it still damages the player.

text: Shower of Sparks deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to target player.
originalText: Shower of Sparks deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to target player.
flavor: The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.

name: Skyshroud Elite
text: Skyshroud Elite gets +1/+2 as long as an opponent controls a nonbasic land.
originalText: Skyshroud Elite gets +1/+2 as long as an opponent controls a nonbasic land.
flavor:
"Civilization is a conspiracy to disguise the mutilation of nature."
—Skyshroud elite creed

name: Slippery Karst

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

text:
Slippery Karst enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
originalText:
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability any time you could play an instant.)
Slippery Karst comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

name: Soltari Foot Soldier
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
originalText: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor:
"Children of the Ruins, raised to be warriors, know that life begins when another speaks their names."
—Soltari Tales of Life

name: Songstitcher
text: {1}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by target attacking creature with flying.
originalText: {1}{W} Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by target attacking creature with flying.
flavor: The true names of birds are songs woven into their souls.

text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
flavor:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching
originalText: Whenever another creature comes into play, you gain 1 life.
name: Soul Warden

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other's ability to trigger.
The life gain is mandatory.

originalText: Steam Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

name: Subversion

rulings.text: This is loss of life, not damage. It can't be prevented.

name: Swords to Plowshares

rulings.text: If the creature has a negative power, the player does not lose life. It acts the same as if it had a power of zero.
The amount of life that's gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
originalText: Remove target creature from the game. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

text: Two target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn.
originalText: Two target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn.
